name: Greek Herb Baked Hake with Tomato-Olive Pan Sauce and Cauli Rice
description: Oven-baked hake gets a bright tomato-olive topping and sits over quick-sautéed cauliflower rice. Mild, keto-friendly, and ready in under 30 minutes for a family dinner.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F; line a sheet pan.
Pat dry hake fillets with paper towels.
Zest and juice the lemon; keep separate.
cook_steps: Place hake fillets on the sheet pan; drizzle 1 tbsp olive oil and season with 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, lemon zest, and oregano.
Bake hake for 10–12 minutes until opaque and flakes easily.
While fish bakes, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a skillet over medium. Add cherry tomatoes and cook 2–3 minutes until they start to soften.
Stir in olives and garlic; cook 1 minute until fragrant. Add 1–2 tbsp lemon juice and half the parsley; simmer 30 seconds. Turn off heat and taste; add a pinch of salt if needed.
In another large skillet, heat 1 tbsp olive oil over medium. Add cauliflower rice and 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper; sauté 4–5 minutes until hot and tender.
Plate cauliflower rice, top with baked hake, and spoon the tomato-olive pan sauce over. Finish with remaining parsley and lemon wedges if desired.
